title: How to learn deeply about wars? Are there any books or website suggestions - Quora

response.answer_text: Your question is extremely broad. Perhaps you could start with one particular war or even the wars of one country in a certain time period to allow an answer that makes sense. There or political reasons for a particular war. There are writings from different sides and viewpoints concerning different wars For instance WW1 can be understudy by reading Barbara W Tuchman’s book The Huns of August. If you learn about WW1 it is easier to understand the causes of WW11.

response.answer_text: There are two tracks - the first is to learn history. Not only the battles but the why of wars. The study of nations and the individuals who begin wars. Then there is the second track. The memoirs of people who fought the wars. The men and women who participated in the harsh reality of the wars others started. I would say, also, talk to veterans. Yea, yea ignore the politics but listen to the stories and though they may be “colored” by time you may be surprised what you will learn.
